rev.comment: /* Entertainment media */ not entertainment, (and potentially a little spam)
rev.diff:
Line 130: Line 130:
Trump is in the process of negotiating a deal with New York City to reopen the [[Tavern on the Green]] restaurant in Central Park, previously one of the world's highest-grossing restaurants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110127/D9L0QORO0.html |title=Trump seeks to run NYC's Tavern on the Green |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-04-21}}</ref>
Trump is in the process of negotiating a deal with New York City to reopen the [[Tavern on the Green]] restaurant in Central Park, previously one of the world's highest-grossing restaurants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110127/D9L0QORO0.html |title=Trump seeks to run NYC's Tavern on the Green |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-04-21}}</ref>
â   â
In the fall of 2009, Trump launched [http://www.trumpnetwork.com/Products/QuikStik.aspx The Trump Network], a direct sales vitamin company. The products include PrivaTest (a multi-vitamin), Silhoutte Solution (a series of weight loss products), and QuikStik (mood infusion beverages). The company positions itself as offering coaching from Trump and entrepreneurship by joining.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://radoff.com/blog/2011/02/23/trump-network-entrepreneurship-rpg/|title=Trump Network as an Entrepreneurship RPG|accessdate=2011-02-23|date=2011-02-23|author=Jon Radoff}}</ref>
 
In March 2011, Trump was the subject of a [[Comedy Central Roast]]. The special was hosted by [[Seth MacFarlane]], and roasters included [[Larry King]], [[Snoop Dogg]], and [[Anthony Jeselnik]] among regular roast participants. Trump's daughter Ivanka was seen in the audience.
In March 2011, Trump was the subject of a [[Comedy Central Roast]]. The special was hosted by [[Seth MacFarlane]], and roasters included [[Larry King]], [[Snoop Dogg]], and [[Anthony Jeselnik]] among regular roast participants. Trump's daughter Ivanka was seen in the audience.
